page.title: 06FARMING IN THE RIB VALLEY.
page.content: The Rib valley is predominately farm land. Today this is mainly arable farming,with a little pasture. Farming in the area,is dominated by a few very large farms. Most of these were part of old estates,which have since become split up. For example,{"Home Farm"} takes its' name from the time when 1 land-lord owned 8 farms,7 of which were rented out. The 8th farm he lived at himself,hence the name{"HOME"}farm. The fields in the valley tend to be very large and intensively farmed. Many of the fields have been enlarged by the removal of some old hedgerows. Wheat,barley and oil-seed rape are the most common crops and a great deal of machinery is used.{"Ashridge Common"} near Cold Christmas,has never had an enclosure order,hence it is called a common. However,today this land has been split up and is used for crops.
